data.title: Seasons and Regulations
data.meta_description: The Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries is responsible for managing and protecting Louisianaâ€™s abundant natural resources. The department issues hunting, fishing, and trapping licenses, as well as boat titles and registrations.
data.text:
Rails and Gallinules September 14-29

November 9 - January 1

Extended Falconry*:

November 2 - January 26

King and Clapper:

15 in aggregate

Sora and Virginia:

25 in aggregate

Gallinules: 15

King and Clapper: 45

Sora and Virginia: 75

Gallinules: 45 Ducks, Coots, Mergansers East Zone:

Regular season: November 16 - December 1 and December 14 - January 26

Youth and veterans only: November 9 and February 1

West Zone:

Regular season: November 9 - December 8; December 21 - January 5; January 18 - 31

Youth: November 2-3

Veterans only: February 1-2

Extended Falconry (all zones):

November 2 - January 29

Ducks: Daily bag limit on ducks is 6 and may include no more

than 4 mallards (no more than 2 females), 3 wood ducks, 2 canvasbacks, 2 redheads, 1 black duck and 1 pintail. Only 1 scaup may be taken for the first 15 days of the season with 2 per day allowed for the remainder. No mottled ducks may be taken for the first 15 days of the season with 1 per day allowed for the remainder. Daily bag limits for scaup and mottled ducks during youth and veterans hunting days are 0 mottled ducks and 1

scaup if before the regular season, 1 mottled duck and 2 scaup if after the regular season.

Coots: 15

Mergansers: 5 (only 2 of which may be hooded) 3 times the daily bag limit 4 Either Sex:

October 1 - January 31 Either Sex:

November 9-15

January 20-31 Either Sex:

November 16 - December 6

January 6 - January 19 Either Sex:

December 7 - January 5 Either Sex:

October 26 - November 1
